intro: Ambrina foetida, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Ambrina foetida is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the plant is crushed.
